game

Class PausePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • game.PausePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class PausePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    The PausePanel shows the pause screen when user wants to pause.
    Version:
    1.0, May 28, 2014 (two image icons are drawn - clear vs pause), 1.1, May 31, 2014 (moved the instantiation to the top), 1.2, June 2, 2014 (JavaDoc), 1.3, June 4, 2014 (Stores the win images, displays win screen, added showWin and resetLevel methods)
    Author:
    Anqi Wu
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PausePanel

        public PausePanel(GameWindow game)
        Creates a new PausePanel object. Sets the background to transparent.
        Parameters:
        game - - GameWindow - The current GameWindow.

    • Method Detail

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Sets paused to the opposite of the current stored value. If paused = true, sets paused to false. If paused = false, sets paused to true.

      • showWin

        public void showWin(int level)

      • resetLevel

        public void resetLevel()

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the graphics of the pause screen. When paused is true, paints the pause screen. When paused is false, paints the clear screen.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - - Graphics - The Graphics object.
